bioghist.p: James Lathim and William Jackson were merchants of Philadelphia, dealing in rum, sugar, tea, coffee, chocolate, spices, and other goods.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two volumes, a journal of sales of merchandise and a ledger of accounts. The account books list entries for items such as rum, sugar, tea, spices, cloth, coffee, molasses, tobacco, and bread, and span 1763-1772 (one sheet dated 1757).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: On deposit from the Wharton School, sent by Richard Clelland, Deputy Provost in 1986
